meta.name: DealMecca Design System
meta.purpose: Comprehensive, AI-friendly specification of the current UI styling, tokens, and component patterns used in this repo. Use this as the single source of truth when building new UI so new features match existing screens.

includes: Global theme tokens (colors, typography, spacing, radii, shadows)
Dark mode strategy and theming rules
Tailwind configuration and semantic color mapping
Global CSS utilities/classes defined in app/globals.css
UI primitives in components/ui (Button, Card, Input, etc.)
Common layout patterns (app shell, marketing/landing pages)
excludes: Every feature component under components/* (too large); prefer composing from components/ui primitives and global classes

canonicalSources.why: Tailwind theme extensions: semantic colors, fonts, shadows, radii, animations.
Actual runtime CSS variables, base styles, and custom utility classes used across the app.
Legacy/alternate design spec (blue/violet brand palette) used by design-system-showcase/. Reference for historical brand colors and optional marketing styling, not necessarily the live app tokens.
Programmatic motion/shadow/spacing tokens used by Framer Motion-based components.
Reusable UI primitives and their exact Tailwind class strings.

notes: This repo currently mixes semantic tokens (bg-background/text-foreground, bg-primary, etc.) with hard-coded Tailwind colors (e.g. bg-white, text-gray-700, focus:ring-blue-500). When extending the UI, prefer semantic tokens unless you are intentionally matching an existing hard-coded pattern in the same area.
The file app/navigation-polish.css exists but is not imported in app/layout.tsx; treat it as inactive unless you intentionally add it.
Lint rules in this repo disallow console.log and require single quotes + semicolons. Avoid adding console.log in new code; use console.warn/error only when necessary.

designJson.summary: Contains a Flokana-inspired SaaS spec with a blue/violet brand core (e.g. #2575FC primary) and matching light/dark palettes. This is used by design-system-showcase/ but is not the canonical source for the current live app theme tokens in app/globals.css.

imports.globalsCss: Google Fonts via @import in app/globals.css (Inter, Roboto, DM Sans)

base.body: body uses @apply bg-background text-foreground font-body; plus font-family var(--font-body)

customUtilityTextStyles.heading-hero: font-headline font-black text-4xl md:text-6xl lg:text-7xl leading-tight text-primary tracking-tight
customUtilityTextStyles.heading-section: font-headline font-black text-3xl md:text-4xl lg:text-5xl text-primary tracking-tight
customUtilityTextStyles.heading-subsection: font-headline font-bold text-xl md:text-2xl lg:text-3xl text-primary tracking-tight
customUtilityTextStyles.heading-display: font-headline font-black text-5xl md:text-7xl lg:text-8xl leading-none text-primary tracking-tighter
customUtilityTextStyles.tagline-hero: font-headline font-semibold text-xl md:text-2xl lg:text-3xl text-secondary

prefersReducedMotion.globalCss: app/globals.css disables animations/transitions when prefers-reduced-motion: reduce

recommendedInteractionPatterns.hover: Use subtle translateY(-2px) and/or shadow increase; avoid large movement.
recommendedInteractionPatterns.press: Use scale(0.98-0.95) for buttons; keep duration <= 150ms.
recommendedInteractionPatterns.loading: Prefer skeletons for long lists; prefer spinners for short operations.

designJsonMapping.intent: Explicit mapping to the legacy design.json palette for AI reference. Use this to match design-system-showcase/ or older marketing specs. For new production UI, prefer the live app tokens in app/globals.css + tailwind.config.ts unless you are intentionally migrating the app to the design.json palette.

ctaGradient.rule: If the screen already uses var(--gradient-accent) (landing page), continue using it. If you are implementing a screen explicitly modeled after design-system-showcase, use the #2575FC/#8B5CF6 gradient.

primarySolid.rule: Prefer bg-primary for consistency. Only use the design.json primary hex when matching the showcase or when explicitly migrating tokens.

focusRing.rule: Prefer focus-visible:ring-ring; avoid hard-coded focus:ring-blue-500 unless matching existing component behavior.

color.formatWarning: The CSS variables --background/--foreground/etc are currently written as space-separated numeric triplets (e.g. '250 250 250'). Tailwind config references them via hsl(var(--...)). When extending styling, prefer using the extended palettes (primary/secondary/accent/neutral) or the hex-based --color-* vars + gradients to match existing screens.

brandGradients.accent: Use for primary CTA backgrounds (buttons/badges) when matching the landing page aesthetic.
brandGradients.textGradient: Use .text-gradient-primary or the style 'background: var(--gradient-primary); background-clip: text; -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent'. Keep to short headline spans, not paragraphs.

inputTextVisibilityFix.intent: Force visible text in inputs/selects/contenteditable in both themes; rules placed outside @layer for maximum precedence.

buttons.btn-primary: bg-primary hover:bg-primary/90 text-white font-medium px-6 py-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 font-headline shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl
buttons.btn-secondary: bg-secondary hover:bg-secondary/90 text-white font-medium px-6 py-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 font-headline shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl
buttons.btn-accent: bg-accent hover:bg-accent/90 text-white font-medium px-6 py-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 font-headline shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl
buttons.btn-outline-primary: border-2 border-primary text-primary hover:bg-primary hover:text-white font-medium px-6 py-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 font-headline
buttons.btn-outline-secondary: border-2 border-secondary text-secondary hover:bg-secondary hover:text-white font-medium px-6 py-3 rounded-lg transition-all duration-200 font-headline

cards.card-enhanced: bg-card text-card-foreground rounded-xl border border-border shadow-lg; hover: shadow-2xl + translateY(-2px)
cards.card-premium: bg-white rounded-xl shadow-lg border border-neutral-200 hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-300
cards.card-premium-dark: bg-neutral-800 rounded-xl shadow-lg border border-neutral-700 hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-300
cards.card-highlight: bg-gradient-accent text-white rounded-xl shadow-lg border-0 hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-300

inputs.input-premium: w-full px-4 py-3 rounded-lg border border-neutral-300 focus:border-secondary focus:ring-2 focus:ring-secondary/20 font-body text-primary placeholder-neutral-400 transition-all duration-200

links.nav-link: font-body text-foreground/80 hover:text-foreground; underline indicator via ::after using bg-accent

effects.glass: Glassmorphism card: rgba background, backdrop blur, 1px border, soft shadow; darker background/shadow in dark mode
effects.skeleton: Shimmer skeleton: bg-muted rounded + animated gradient background; (Note: components/ui/Skeleton uses animate-pulse + bg-muted)

gradients.text-gradient-primary: background: var(--gradient-primary); background-clip:text; -webkit-text-fill-color:transparent; animated gradient shift

eventsPageUtilities.progress-bar-animated: animation: progressFill 0.8s ease-out forwards; width uses --progress-width
eventsPageUtilities.event-card-hover: hover: translateY(-4px) scale(1.01) + multi-shadow including blue glow

cn.usage: Always merge Tailwind classes via cn(...), which uses clsx + tailwind-merge to avoid conflicting classes.

Button.baseClass: inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap rounded-md text-sm font-medium ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50
importantNotes: The 'orange' variant references 'bg-brand-orange' which is not defined in tailwind.config.ts; avoid using this variant unless you add the color token.
Button currently does NOT implement Slot/asChild behavior (it always renders a <button>). Avoid nesting <a> inside <button>; prefer <Link><Button .../></Link> patterns.

Badge.baseClass: inline-flex items-center rounded-full border px-2.5 py-0.5 text-xs font-semibold transition-colors focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-ring focus:ring-offset-2
Badge.usage: Use for short labels, counts, and small status indicators.

notes: CardDescription uses hard-coded text-gray-700 (not theme-semantic). If you need proper dark-mode, override with text-muted-foreground or conditional dark classes.

Input.baseClass: flex h-10 w-full rounded-md border border-input bg-background px-3 py-2 text-sm ring-offset-background file:border-0 file:bg-transparent file:text-sm file:font-medium placeholder:text-gray-500 focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50
notes: Input text visibility is forcibly overridden by app/globals.css to ensure readable text in light/dark modes.

Textarea.baseClass: flex min-h-[80px] w-full rounded-md border border-input bg-background px-3 py-2 text-sm ring-offset-background placeholder:text-gray-500 focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50

Select.baseClass: flex h-10 w-full items-center rounded-md border border-gray-300 bg-white px-3 py-2 text-sm focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50
notes: This component uses hard-coded gray/blue colors. If you need semantic theming, override classes or create a themed variant.

Checkbox.baseClass: peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-gray-300 ring-offset-white focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-blue-500 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50
notes: Uses aria-checked including mixed state when indeterminate.
Uses hard-coded blue focus ring and fill.

Switch.implementation: Label + hidden input; styled track + thumb
Switch.baseClass: Track: w-11 h-6 rounded-full; Thumb: h-5 w-5 rounded-full; transitions duration-200
notes: This component uses hard-coded blue focus and on state.

Progress.track: relative h-2 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-gray-200
Progress.bar: h-full w-full flex-1 bg-blue-600 transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out

Avatar.Avatar: relative flex h-10 w-10 shrink-0 overflow-hidden rounded-full
Avatar.AvatarFallback: flex h-full w-full items-center justify-center rounded-full bg-gray-100 text-gray-600 text-sm font-medium

DropdownMenu.content: rounded-md border bg-popover p-1 text-popover-foreground shadow-md; animated enter/exit
DropdownMenu.item: rounded-sm px-2 py-1.5 text-sm; focus:bg-accent focus:text-accent-foreground

Dialog.implementation: Custom (not Radix) dialog with Context + overlay
Dialog.overlay: fixed inset-0 z-50 bg-black/50 (clicking overlay closes)
Dialog.content: fixed inset-0 z-[60] flex items-center justify-center p-4; inner panel: relative bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg max-w-lg w-full max-h-[90vh] overflow-y-auto

Tabs.TabsList: inline-flex h-10 items-center justify-center rounded-md bg-gray-100 p-1 text-gray-700

TabsTrigger.base: rounded-sm px-3 py-1.5 text-sm font-medium transition-all focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-blue-500 focus-visible:ring-offset-2

notes: Tabs intentionally avoids rendering on initial SSR when uncontrolled to prevent hydration mismatch.
There is also a more elaborate .skeleton shimmer implementation in app/globals.css; choose based on screen consistency.

stickyHeaders: PageHeader: sticky top-0 z-40 bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm shadow-sm border-b
Landing header: sticky top-0 z-50 bg-white/95 dark:bg-slate-900/95 backdrop-blur-sm border-b

marketingLanding.primaryAesthetic: High-contrast slate neutrals + gradient accents (var(--gradient-accent) / var(--gradient-primary))
rules: Use large white/near-white surfaces with subtle borders: border-slate-200 (dark: border-slate-700).
Use rounded-2xl/rounded-xl on hero cards and CTAs.
Use gradient accent for primary CTA backgrounds; keep text white.
Keep body copy in slate-600 (dark: slate-300) and headings in slate-900 (dark: white).
Use components/ui/Input, Textarea, Select where possible for consistent padding/radius/focus.
Always provide labels (components/ui/Label) and helper/error text.
Inputs have special global overrides for text visibility; avoid applying gradient text utilities to input wrappers.
Prefer Card surfaces for grouped content.
Use subtle dividers (bg-border / border-gray-100) and generous padding.
Use Skeleton loading states for list fetches.

focus.rule: Never remove focus outlines. All interactive elements must show a visible focus ring.
existingPatterns: Some components use focus-visible:ring-blue-500 (Tabs/Checkbox/Dialog close button)

notes: Mobile nav items in app/navigation-polish.css were designed with 44px min target, but that file is not currently imported. Apply the same principle when building new UI.

reducedMotion.rule: Respect prefers-reduced-motion: reduce across CSS transitions and Framer Motion animations.

colorContrast.rule: Ensure AA contrast for text on buttons/cards in both themes. Prefer semantic tokens over arbitrary colors.

iconography.stroke: Default Lucide stroke (keep consistent; avoid mixing icon sets)
usageGuidelines: Use icons as supportive signals, not decoration.
Pair icons with labels in navigation and buttons when space allows.
Keep icon color aligned to text color unless used as a status indicator (success/warning/error).

preferred: Use semantic utilities: bg-background, text-foreground, bg-card, border-border, text-muted-foreground, bg-primary/secondary/accent.
Use the shared primitives in components/ui before building new UI from scratch.
avoid: Avoid creating new one-off global CSS classes unless it’s a widely reused pattern.
Avoid inline styles for colors; prefer CSS variables (var(--gradient-accent)) only when matching existing landing sections.
Avoid using gradient text utilities on form fields or placeholders (this has historically caused invisible input text).

typescriptAndLint.noConsole: Disallow console.log; allow console.warn and console.error
